llm.feedback:
Your draft needs to be tightened to meet the strict format and evidence‑driven standards. 1) **Trim to exactly 4 lines** (2 Up, 2 Down). 2) Each line must read **Up/Down | Time window | Driver/Mechanism | What to watch | Probability %** and include a canonical handle with a clear sign/magnitude (e.g., DXY ↓ 0.8–1.5 % or ust10y ↑ 10–20 bps). 3) Add inline citations for every driver, watch item, and probability (IDs from the source). 4) Remove the erroneous “Down | 3‑6 mo | 96.0 | 96.5 | 95.8” line; replace it with a proper swing‑trade line (see below). 5) **Add a Swing Trade plan** after the 4 lines, formatted exactly as:  
**Down | 3‑6 mo | Entry 96.0 | Stop 96.5 | Target 95.8 | R/R 1.4 | Invalidation Fed holds/raises or core PCE > 3 % | Trigger Fed minutes, core PCE > 3 % | Probability 70 % | Confidence 80**.  
6) Ensure every driver links to a canonical handle (e.g., DXY, ust10y, mbs_spread) and that the magnitude range is explicit. 7) Keep the language concise, avoid generic platitudes, and do not include any trailing citation lists. 8) Verify that the probabilities are grounded in the cited evidence (e.g., 89 % Fed‑cut odds, 57 bp spread steepening). 9) Finally, double‑check that the trade/outlook plan is actionable and forward‑looking, with clear entry, stop, target, and invalidation triggers.
